thread.title: The Paradox of Humanizing Star Wars' Stormtroopers
thread.title_full: The Paradox of Humanizing Star Wars' Stormtroopers

author: Evan Narcisse
title: The Paradox of Humanizing Star Wars' Stormtroopers
text:
Go to permalink GIF 
The Force Awakens did something no other Star Wars movie had done: it made a hero out of a Stormtrooper. But doing that complicates what it means to kill the ubiquitous canon fodder of this fictional universe. 
In the latest edition of his Pop Culture Detective Agency series , Jonathan McIntosh breaks down how the start of Finn’s hero journey makes the existential quandary of killing stormtroopers a lot murkier. After all, if Finn can reject the programming that made him a soulless grunt in an oppressive regime, couldn’t other stormtroopers do the same?
